news_header: An Afghan national was arrested in Oklahoma for allegedly planning an attack on election day in support of the Islamic State.
news_text: Nasir A. T., a 27-year-old Afghan national, was arrested in Oklahoma for plotting a violent attack on US soil in support of the Islamic State. He allegedly communicated with someone he believed was affiliated with IS and, along with a minor co-conspirator, attempted to purchase firearms from an undercover FBI agent. A. T. entered the US in 2021 under a Special Immigrant Visa Program. Following his arrest, he reportedly stated that the attack was aimed at large gatherings and that he intended to die as a martyr. The FBI and Department of Homeland Security highlighted ongoing threats from lone offenders and small groups, particularly in light of upcoming elections.
